title: Language-Based Mechanics Concept Understanding Through Culturally Integrated Physics Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level foundational physics knowledge and experience applying language in workplace settings
context.additional_context: Program simulating physics concept learning with cultural context reflection in a virtual environment to enhance workplace global collaboration

learning_goals: Participants can apply cultural elements of the Philippine traditional game "Laro-ng-Lahi" to a VR simulation to explain Newtonian mechanics concepts (force, motion, friction).
Learners can analyze cultural application cases of physics concepts with 80% accuracy through descriptive assessments after simulation activities.
Participants can compare and explain the impact of cultural context on scientific concept comprehension using at least three keywords in a peer evaluation system.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
